I decided to include it none the less because it is so popular in green circles and has become a touchstone for environmentalists, whatever its origin

has made a vast contribution to the development of green economics, covering areas such as the reorganization of work, the design of just money systems, and taxation and welfare policy

gave the green economist the slogan ‘small is beautiful’, summarizing his concern with scale in economics. His other major contributions were in terms of intermediate technology and his Buddhist economics

invented the field of ‘evolutionary economics’ – an attempt to combine economics with ecology. He proposed a circular rather than a linear economy and invented the analogy of the spaceship Earth as a symbol for the way we should care for our planet
made his major contribution by
